instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
threads.message:
Board came in with liquid damage and a short, after fixing the short board now works, but fans start to run fast after a few minutes of use, the Mac is not slow its just the fans that are loud. I checked the temperature of CPU etc. with MacFanControl and they all seem fine, so I am inclined that this is a sensor issue.

I tested this board on another Mac that has no issues and the problem is the same.

Any pointers on how to check sensors and see what it could be?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
threads.message:
So you tried same MLB with good LIO flex/board and good trackpad flex/board?

Did you also try it with another LCD assembly?
If not, disconnect webcam and test again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
threads.message: The only thing that I put on the good known housing was the MLB all other components are fine as that other MacBook has no issues and yes that includes good trackpad flex/board and screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
threads.message:
Instal HWMonitor, I think it shows more information.
Check current sensors too, apart of temps.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
threads.message: Thanks, Memory Bank A1 is showing 128c, not sure what to look at but I will check the board again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
threads.message: Those look clean, around the smc there are similar sensors, I removed  those and resoldered them but no luck

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
threads.message:
Did you check traces continuity???
These sensors are far away of <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>...
